intro: Antirhea ekmanii, commonly known as the Kew's antirhea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
